metadata.title: CVE-2013-1416 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The prep_reprocess_req function in do_tgs_req.c in the Key DistributionCenter (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.10.5 does not properlyperform service-principal realm referral, which allows remote authenticatedusers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemoncrash) via a crafted TGS-REQ request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1416` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-gss-samples - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-kdc - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-locales - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-multidev - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-pkinit - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
krb5-user - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libgssrpc4 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libk5crypto3 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libkadm5clnt-mit8 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libkdb5-7 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libkrb5-3 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
libkrb5support0 - 1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.11.3+dfsg-3ubuntu2').
